text.0: let thy bay horses yoked o mighty indra bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing.
text.1: for thee the heavenly een the poor invoketh may we this day thy feastcompanions prosper.
text.2: forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service and purified proceed directly forward.
text.3: may indra drink of this our guest aforetime celestial king of the strong draught of soma.
text.4: bringing us hitherward allpotent indra on wellwheeled chariot may the steeds who bear him.
text.5: convey him on the road direct to glory and neer may vāyus amṛta cease and fail him.
text.6: supreme he stirs this man to give the guerdonindra most efficacious of the princes.
text.7: wherewith o thunderer thou removest sorrow and bold one partest wealth among the nobles.
text.8: indra is hewho gives enduring vigour may our songs magnify the god most mighty.
text.9: best vṛtraslayer be the hero indra these things he gives as prince with strong endeavour.
